1.name: Cleopatra
1.description: The story of Cleopatra, the fabulous queen of Egypt, and the epic romances between her and the greatest men of Rome, Julius Caesar and Antony.

2.name: Terje Vigen
2.description: Terje Vigen, a sailor, suffers the loss of his family through the cruelty of another man. Years later, when his enemy's family finds itself dependent on Terje's beneficence, Terje must ...                See full summary »

3.name: The Poor Little Rich Girl
3.description: The wealthy but selfish parents of a lonely young girl begin to rethink what is important to them after a servant's irresponsibility results in a crisis.

4.name: A Romance of the Redwoods
4.description: A young girl travels west to live with her uncle during the California Gold Rush only to find that he has been killed by Indians and his identity assumed by an outlaw.

5.name: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
5.description: With her family in financial difficulties, Rebecca is sent to live with her two strict, unfeeling aunts, who do not appreciate the young girl's charm and energy. Rebecca must make new ...                See full summary »

6.name: The Little American
6.description: A young American has her ship torpedoed by a German U-boat but makes it back to ancestral home in France, where she witnesses German brutality firsthand.

7.name: The Little Princess
7.description: Little Sara Crewe is placed in a boarding school by her father when he goes off to war, but he does not understand that the headmistress is a cruel, spiteful woman who makes life miserable ...                See full summary »

8.name: Satyavadi Raja Harishchandra
8.description: The homage to the upright King Harishchandra who almost sacrifices his kingdom for his love of truth, opens with a tableau showing the king, his wife Taramati and his young son, to whom he ...                See full summary »

9.name: The Woman God Forgot
9.description: Cortez sends Alvarado to Montezuma who throws him into a dungeon from which he is rescued by Tecza who loves him. He is recaptured when her lover Guatemoco finds Alvarado hiding in her ...                See full summary »

10.name: The Heart of Texas Ryan
10.description: Colonel William Ryan, a ranch owner, in the Lone Star State, has named his only daughter Texas. Jack Parker, a devil-may-care cowpuncher, loves only two things, one is his horse and the ...                See full summary »

11.name: The Pride of the Clan
11.description: Among the simple fisher-folk of a little island off the west coast of Scotland lives MacTavish, head of a clan. Here he rules as a chieftain and his word is law. One day a hurricane sweeps ...                See full summary »

12.name: La agonía de Arauco
12.description: A father accidentally kills his son and then commits suicide. The wife (Isabel) begins a long journey of pain and forgetfulness towards the south of Chile, there she meets a mapuche child an the conflict of her culture. It is the first directed by a woman, silent film pioneer of Chilean cinematography.

13.name: A Tale of Two Cities
13.description: Alcoholic lawyer Sydney Carton travels to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.

14.name: Bucking Broadway
14.description: A ranch foreman battles a rich stockbroker for the affections of a beautiful young woman.

15.name: Les Misérables
15.description: Jean Valjean, a good and decent man who has committed a minor crime, is imprisoned but escapes. He is pursued thereafter for years by Javert, the cruel and implacable arm of the law.

18.name: Umirayushchiy lebed
18.description: A grief-stricken ballerina becomes the obsession of an increasingly unhinged artist.

19.name: Rapsodia satanica
19.description: A Faustian tale about an old woman who makes a pact with Mephisto to regain her youth, in return she must stay away from love. After the deal she meets two brothers who fall in love with her.

20.name: Der Golem und die Tänzerin
20.description: As a practical joke, an actor impersonates the screen monster he made famous. Complications ensue.

21.name: Seven Keys to Baldpate
21.description: A writer bets a friend that he can write a 10,000-word novel in 24 hours. The friends takes the bet, and gives him the keys to his Baldpate Inn, which has been closed for the winter, so he ...                See full summary »

22.name: Blue Jeans
22.description: Perry Bascom comes to the town of Rising Sun, Indiana, to take charge of the sawmills which have for years been managed by his father's best friend, Col. Henry Clay Risener. His father's ...                See full summary »

23.name: El apóstol
23.description: Argentinian President Yrigoyen burns Buenos Aires using Jupiter's thunderbolts.

24.name: Straight Shooting
24.description: Cattleman Flint cuts off farmer Sims' water supply. When Sims' son Ted goes for water, one of Flint's men kills him. Cheyenne is sent to finish off Sims, but finding the family at the newly dug grave, he changes sides.

25.name: The Darling of Paris
25.description: A gypsy girl with her foster-mother arrive in the French Capital where her beauty attracts the attention of the Apaches, and she becomes a member of their band. Her beauty attracts Claude ...                See full summary »

26.description: A retired judge comes West to restore a ghost town.

27.name: Madame Du Barry
27.description: Jeanette (Theda Bara), unknown in Paris but of great beauty and wit, attracts the attention of Louis XV (Charles Clary) who expresses a desire to meet her to Jean Du Barry (Herschel Mayall)...                See full synopsis »

29.name: The Vicar of Wakefield
29.description: Dr. Primrose, the vicar of Wakefield, enjoys life with his wife and five children. His two daughters, Olivia and Sophia, are courted by two apparent gentlemen, Mr. Burchell and Squire ...                See full summary »

30.name: The Great White Trail
30.description: A husband, mistakenly believing his wife has cheated on him and that he is now the father of their newborn son, throws both her and her child out of the house. Frantic to the point of ...                See full summary »

31.name: Patria
31.description: Serial about Japanese spies trying to invade the US but whose plans are foiled by a rich heiress and a Secret Service agent.

32.name: Runaway Romany
32.description: "Inky" Ames, theatrical press agent, through a fictitious story makes it appear that Anitra St. Clair, an actress, is the long lost daughter of Theodore True, the copper king. True accepts ...                See full summary »

33.name: Reaching for the Moon
33.description: A factory worker has always dreamed that he was meant for better things, to be rich and famous and in "the company of kings". One day he discovers that he is indeed the only heir to the ...                See full summary »

34.name: Thais
34.description: Paphnutius, a wealthy Alexandrian, is about to embrace the new faith of Christianity, but is persuaded by a friend to first see Thais, the most notable courtesan of her time. He falls in ...                See full summary »

35.name: Camille
35.description: Camille is a courtesan in Paris. She falls deeply in love with a young man of promise, Armand Duval. When Armand's father begs her not to ruin his hopes of a career and position by marrying...                See full summary »

36.name: The Price of a Good Time
36.description: A poor shopgirl is offered a "good time" for a week by the son of her employer. She accepts, but the offer is misunderstood by her brother, who informs the girl's parents of her "fling."

37.name: The Silent Man
37.description: A gold prospector strikes it rich, but the crooks who run a frontier town take it away from him. He determines to get it back and clean up the town.

38.name: Mater dolorosa
38.description: Sad story of an unfaithful wife and her subsequent sufferings as a mother.

41.name: The Avenging Trail
41.description: Lumberjack Gaston Olaf is newly arrived in the lumber camp of Havens Falls, but it isn't long before he finds himself coming to the rescue of the lovely Rose Havens, who is being pursued by...                See full summary »

42.name: Tösen från Stormyrtorpet
42.description: Helga is a young single lady who has a baby by a much older married man. After the older man tells Helga's father that he refuses to pay child support because he isn't the child's father, ...                See full summary »

43.name: The Slave Market
43.description: Ramona is the daughter of the governor of Port Royal. She is a school girl living in Spain. John Barton, a soldier of fortune, is cast ashore in Spain penniless and scrapes an acquaintance ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Gulf Between
44.description: A young woman, who is the daughter of a sea captain, falls in love with a man from a rich family who does not approve of her.

45.name: The Secret Game
45.description: During the Great War, German and Japanese spies face off in the United States.

46.name: The Fall of the Romanoffs
46.description: A dramatization of the Russian revolution and the influence upon the Russian royal family of the famous "mad monk," Rasputin.

47.name: A Girl's Folly
47.description: A restless young girl yearns to leave her rural environment and "get away from it all". One day she stumbles upon a film crew shooting a western near her home. She makes friends with the ...                See full summary »

49.name: The Weavers of Life
49.description: Peggy, a young department-store salesgirl, finds a box with a costume and an invitation to a masquerade ball at the home of wealthy Austin Pratt. On the night of the ball she puts on the ...                See full summary »
